p.k: Today: Faith in Amida, believers pray for guidance to the Pure Land. Kyoto continues to be innovative 1,200 years after its foundation. We dive deep into its core in this definitive program.
p.d: Buddhists faithful intone "Namu Amida Butsu" in ardent prayer to Amida Buddha for the release from suffering and death in this world into the Pure Land of Ultimate Bliss. "Namu" means to embrace or take refuge in something. In this ideology, believers supplicate for a peaceful death and salvation in the afterlife. Discover the diverse faiths in Amida through Kyoto temples, the majority of which are dedicated to this celestial Buddha.
